name: ArtifactoryNpm
description: Install, pack and publish npm packages from and to Artifactory while allowing to collect build-info. The collected build-info can be later published to Artifactory by the "Artifactory Publish Build Info" task.
author: JFrog

inputs.name: artifactoryService
inputs.label: Artifactory service
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Artifactory service used by the task.

inputs.name: sourceRepo
inputs.label: Npm source repository
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The source npm repository.
Can be local, remote, or a virtual npm repository.

inputs.name: targetRepo
inputs.label: Npm target repository
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The target npm repository
Can be local, or a virtual npm repository containing local repositories.

inputs.name: workingFolder
inputs.label: Working folder with package.json
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the folder containing the target package.json and .npmrc files. Select the folder, not the file e.g. "/packages/mypackage".

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Npm arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: A list of npm arguments and options in the form of "--arg1=value1 --arg2=value2".

inputs.name: collectBuildInfo
inputs.label: Collect build info
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select to collect build info and store it locally.
The build info can be later published to Artifactory using the "Artifactory Publish Build Info" task.

inputs.name: threads
inputs.label: Build info threads
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Number of working threads for build-info collection.
Calculating the build-info requires sending a series of requests to Artifactory.
Since some build agents may have limited network resources, the default for 'Build info threads' is set to 1.
Increasing the threads amount should consume more resources, but can also improve performance.

inputs.name: buildName
inputs.label: Build name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Build name.
To use the default build name of the pipeline, set the field to '$(Build.DefinitionName)'.
The collected build-info should be published to Artifactory using the 'Artifactory Publish Build Info' task.

inputs.name: buildNumber
inputs.label: Build number
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Build number.
To use the default build number of the pipeline, set the field to '$(Build.BuildNumber)'.
The collected build-info should be published to Artifactory using the 'Artifactory Publish Build Info' task.

inputs.name: includeEnvVars
inputs.label: Include environment variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to include environment variables in the published build info.
